alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 3:50PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Muscogee and Chattahoochee Counties through 415 PM EST... At 349 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was over Fort Mitchell, or 8 miles south of Phenix City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Cusseta, North Fort Benning, Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld, Saint Marys Hills, Edgewood, Highland Park, Sand Hill, Battle Park, Vista Terrace, Kenwood, Custer Road Terrace, Eelbeck/West Fort Benning, Benning Hills, Avondale, Benning Park and Carter Acres. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
